In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is how you can solve this problem using Julia programming language with the DataFrames.jl package:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[:dt])
end
```

This function maps over each DateTime in the `dt` column of the DataFrame and extracts the year and month using the `Dates.year` and `Dates.month` functions respectively. It then combines these into a single integer by multiplying the year by 100 (to shift months into the thousands) and adding the month.

Here is an example of how to use this function:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime("2020-05-30"), DateTime("2021-10-15")])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will add a new column `ym` to the DataFrame with values 20205 and 202110 respectively.
